identity.name: E1
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Industrial Safety aesthetics with Cyberpunk UI
Emotion First: Feel like a powerful engineering tool
Content is King: The project plan is the hero
Zoom In: Focus on the code and wiring details
Negative Space: Don't clutter the workbench
Contrast: High visibility for safety and readability

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Key metrics

code.usage: Code blocks, terminal outputs, technical specs

rules: Line height: 'leading-none' for headers, 'leading-relaxed' for body

primary.description: Electric Amber - Represents power, filaments, warning lights

secondary.description: Cyan - Represents data flow, circuitry, signals

inputs.style: bg-black/50 border-white/10 focus:border-primary/50 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-primary/50 rounded-sm font-mono text-sm

stepper.step_dot: absolute -left-[5px] w-2.5 h-2.5 rounded-full bg-neutral-800 ring-4 ring-neutral-950

visual_enhancers.textures: Use subtle noise overlay on the main background

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. INSTALL FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import links to the <head> of public/index.html or import in index.css.
2. CONFIGURE TAILWIND: Update tailwind.config.js with the 'Cyber-Industrial' colors and font families.
3. GLOBAL STYLES: Apply the dark background (#050505) and text color globally in index.css.
4. MOBILE NAV: Implement a fixed bottom navigation bar for mobile. Hide it on desktop if needed, or move to side.
5. PROJECT FLOW: The 7-stage workflow is the core. Use a vertical stepper or accordion layout.
6. CODE BLOCKS: Use a custom CodeBlock component with syntax highlighting and a 'Copy' button. Style it like a terminal.
7. SETTINGS: Add the API Key management and Theme Toggle here. Default to Dark Mode.
8. SHADCN: Customize all Shadcn components to remove the default 'radius' and 'border' styles. Make them sharper and darker.
9. DATA-TESTID: Add data-testid attributes to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, links).
universal_guidelines: Avoid 'AI Slop': No generic gradients, no centered text everywhere.
Dark Mode First: The app is designed for dark mode. Light mode is secondary.
Micro-interactions: Add hover states to everything. Buttons should glow or lift.
Spacing: Use p-6 or p-8 inside cards. Don't cram content.
Accessibility: Ensure text contrast is high (Amber on Black is good, but check Grey on Black).
